LowCost.body: Blockchains enable instant global money transfers with near zero fees. Nulla Pay integrates already existing blockchain infrastructure (Polygon network, Web3Auth, cryptocurrency exchanges, and others) to create a cost-efficient system.
LowCost.card-1-body: Nulla Pay does not take a cut from any transaction.
LowCost.card-2-body-1: Transferring funds to the bank costs near zero
LowCost.card-3-body-1: Nulla Pay does not skim profits by giving you bad USDC-{merchantCurrency} conversion rates. We use the rates from {cex} Exchange, which are true market rates.

Simple.body-1: Our app is minimalistic and easy to learn.
Simple.body-2: If you have a PoS system, just glance at the Nulla App to confirm payment. Then, enter the transaction in your PoS system as a cash payment. This way, all transactions are kept in a single system and your overhead remains low while using Nulla Pay.

Why.header: Attract new customers & enable frictionless spending
Why.card-1-body: There are now 50+ million users with MetaMask. These numbers are growing fast, particularly among young people.
Why.card-2-body: Surveys show >80% of travelers prefer paying with USDC instead of cash/card because the USDC➜{merchantCurrency} rate is usually 1-5% better than the USD➜{merchantCurrency} rate at any bank, including Wise.
Why.card-2-usd-body: You control the entire payments process when you use Nulla Pay. No one can withhold payment or block you from using the system.
Why.card-3-body: People who keep their savings on the blockchain may be willing to spend more when using USDC than when using card or cash.

Learn.subheader: In 5 short lessons, learn the basics of blockchain
Learn.title4: How do I use the blockchain?
Learn.lesson-1-1: A blockchain is like a banking system.
Learn.lesson-1-2: The banking system is composed of accounts, where accounts can transfer currencies (USD, EUR, YEN) to other accounts. Account balances and transactions are stored in servers secured by bank employees.
Learn.lesson-1-3: Similarly, a blockchain is composed of <span1>blockchain accounts</span1>, where accounts can transfer <span2>tokens</span2> (USDC, USDT, BTC) to other accounts. Account balances and transactions are stored in thousands of servers globally and secured by tens of thousands of individuals who are incentivized to maintain accurate records. Over 10+ years with $30+ trillion transacted, blockchains have proven to be very secure financial networks.
Learn.lesson-1-4: Every blockchain account is assigned a unique address, which is like a bank account number. When you send tokens, you will need to enter the recipient’s blockchain address. To receive tokens, you will need to share your blockchain address with the sender. As you see, sending and receiving tokens on the blockchain is very similar to sending and recieving money in the banking system.
Learn.lesson-2: Today, there are 100’s of blockchains. What helps simplify matters is that most blockchains, including 7 of the top 10 blockchains (Ethereum, BSC, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, Polygon, Avalanche, Blast), are built using the same technology called the <span1>Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)</span1>. An advantage of EVM is that a single EVM blockchain account can be used for all EVM blockchains. For example, if you have an EVM blockchain account and your EVM address is <span2>0x709D8145D21681f8287a556C67cD58Cb8A7FB3Aa</span2>, you can use this same address to receive tokens on the Ethereum chain, Polygon chain, or any other EVM chain. Payments on Nulla Pay use an EVM chain (Polygon), so for now we'll only focus on EVM blockchains.
Learn.lesson-3-1: Some tokens do not have value, while others do. USDC is a token issued by Circle (a highly regulated U.S.-based company) and is backed one-to-one by USD. The USD reserves are held in major U.S. banks with quarterly attestations. Therefore, 1 USDC has a value equal to 1 USD.
Learn.lesson-3-2: USDC is an example of a currency-backed stablecoin. Similarly, EUROC and JPYC are also currency-backed stablecoins that represent 1 EURO and 1 JPY, respectively. Currently, Nulla Pay only allows USDC transactions because most blockchain users already possess and use USDC. When other stablecoins become more popular, we will integrate them.
Learn.lesson-4-1: To start using the blockchain, most people will first register an account on a cryptocurrency exchange. A cryptocurrency exchange (e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Crypto.com, etc.) is a platform where you can buy or sell tokens (e.g., USDC) with fiat currency (e.g., {merchantCurrency}). A cryptocurrency exchange account comes with an EVM blockchain address, so you can use your cryptocurrency exchange account to send tokens to or receive tokens from other EVM blockchain accounts. Cryptocurrency exchanges are essentially gateways to the blockchain world.
Learn.lesson-4-2: After getting a cryptocurrency exchange account, most people will then download a Web3 wallet app (e.g., MetaMask, Coinbase Wallet, Phantom, SafePal, etc.) and then send tokens from their cryptocurrency exchange account to it. MetaMask is by far the most popular Web3 wallet, so we’ll use MetaMask as an example. When you download the MetaMask app, you will be asked to create an EVM blockchain account. You can then send/receive tokens from the app, just like a cryptocurrency exchange account.
Learn.lesson-4-3: There are 2 main reasons why people want their tokens in a Web3 wallet rather than on a cryptocurrency exchange: 1) Sending/receiving tokens on a Web3 wallet takes ~3s, compared to ~3 minutes on a cryptocurrency exchange. 2) A Web3 wallet can connect with thousands of blockchain-based web applications. For example, you can earn U.S. treasury rates on the blockchain. To do this, first buy USDC tokens on a cryptocurrency exchange. Then, send the USDC to MetaMask. With MetaMask, you can connect to the Flux Finance website and deposit your USDC on there to earn U.S. treasury rates (~5% APR).
Learn.lesson-4-4: With 50+ million people transacting on the blockchain, a large majority of these people will likely have the MetaMask app on their phones and USDC tokens in it. That is why Nulla Pay was designed for customers to pay with the MetaMask app and USDC tokens.
Learn.lesson-5-1: If you have MetaMask, you can easily receive USDC payments from customers. What can Nulla Pay do that MetaMask cannot do?
Learn.lesson-5-2:
First, most blockchain users transact in USDC (1 USDC = 1 USD). In non-USD countries, businesses and customers will have to agree on how much USDC should be sent for payment. With Nulla Pay, the customer can enter the amount of local currency ({merchantCurrency}) for payment. Nulla Pay then applies a fair exchange rate to calculate the amount of USDC sent for payment. Nulla Pay does not profit through exchange rates, so you and your customers are always gauranteed true market rates. Furthermore, Nulla Pay is designed so that you will not lose money from fluctuating rates (how?
{tooltip}
).
Learn.lesson-5-3: Furthermore, with Nulla Pay, businesses do not need to worry about 12-word secret phrases or gas tokens, making Nulla Pay much easier to use than MetaMask. Lastly, businesses can download a .CSV file of all payment details to help with accounting.
Learn.lesson-5-4: Nulla Pay also helps businesses cash out to the bank with zero additional fees. Without Nulla Pay, businesses will have to transfer tokens from MetaMask to their cryptocurrency exchange, log into their cryptocurrency exchange, sell USDC, and make a withdrawal to their bank. This is a time consuming process. With Nulla Pay,businesses can cash out to their bank in a single interface on the Nulla App.
Learn.lesson-5-5: The functions above cannot be completed with MetaMask alone. Nulla Pay is a simple, low-cost tool that can help any business set up crypto payments.

employeePass.title: What is the Employee Password?
employeePass.text-1: If you set an <span1>Employee Password</span1>, employees can sign into the Nulla App using your account's email address and the employee password. Employees will be able to see all customer payments, so they can confirm payments when customers pay.
employeePass.text-3: Because employees do not have access to the funds in Nulla Pay, they cannot make refunds. However, employees can label/unlabel payments with the "To Refund" tag. You (the owner) can then later refund all payments with this label in a single click.

cashback.title: What is the 2% Cashback?
cashback.text-1: We are temporarily requiring businesses give customers a 2% discount, which will be applied at the time of payment. The entire discount will go to the customer, as Nulla Pay does not make any profit from transactions.
cashback.text-2: Because most credit cards offer 1% cashback, the 2% discount is needed to help motivate customers to pay with USDC instead. Because Nulla Pay charges 0% fees and credit cards charge > 3% fees, you still save money when using Nulla Pay. Furthermore, the discount may attract new customers to your business.
cashback.text-3: When crypto payments become more popular, we will make this cashback optional.

google.title: What is the Google ID?
google.text-1: Search "Google Place ID Finder" and go to the Google Place ID Finder website. Find your Google Place ID and paste it here. When you do, your business will be added to https://www.stablecoinmap.com, which is a database of places that accept crypto payments, thus allowing crypto users to more easily find your business.

platformAddress.title: What is the Cash Out Address?
platformAddress.text-1: The Cash Out Address is your Cash Out Platform's USDC deposit address on the Polygon chain. To find this address, in your cryptocurrency exchange, click the "Deposit", "Receive", or similar button. Select "USDC" as the token you want to deposit and select "Polygon" as the network. Copy the shown address (starts with "0x").

CashbackModal.text-2: Our mission is to create a global payments platform with near-zero fees.
CashbackModal.text-3: However, a major challenge is that credit cards give ~1% back to customers (while taking 3-5% from businesses), locking customers into only using credit cards.
CashbackModal.text-4: To be able to compete, we are temporarily requiring businesses give a 2% discount to customers who pay through Nulla Pay. The discount will be applied at the time of payment.
CashbackModal.text-5: You will still save money using Nulla Pay (0% fees) over credit cards. This discount may also attract new customers to your business!
CashbackModal.text-6: When crypto payments become more popular, we will make this 2% discount optional.

InstructionsModal.setup-1: To start accepting crypto payments, print out and display your QR code so that customers can see it.
InstructionsModal.setup-2: We emailed you the QR code when you created this account. You can re-send the email or download the QR code by going to Payments > QR Code > Export.
InstructionsModal.setup-3: Instructions on how to print and display your QR Code will be provided when you export it.
InstructionsModal.pay-1: Before payment, the customer must have the <span1><span2>MetaMask app<sup1>?</sup1></span2><div1>{tooltip1}</div1></span1> and <span3><span4>USDC<sup2>?</sup2></span4><div2>{tooltip2}</div2></span3> tokens on the <span5><span6>Polygon network<sup3>?</sup3></span6><div3>{tooltip3}</div3></span5>.
InstructionsModal.pay-2: To pay, the customer scans your QR code, which opens their Metamask app. In the app, the customer enters the amount of {merchantCurrency} for payment.
InstructionsModal.pay-3: When the customer submits payment, USDC tokens (equal in value to the amount of {merchantCurrency} entered) will be sent from their MetaMask to your Nulla App.
InstructionsModal.confirm-1: About 3-6s after a customer makes a payment, you will receive a notification in the Nulla App and see the payment under Payments.
InstructionsModal.log-1: A record of all payments made through Nulla Pay can be downloaded as a .CSV file in the Payments menu.
InstructionsModal.log-2: If you have PoS device, we recommend you log the payment in your PoS device as a cash payment. That way, you have a record of the payment in your PoS system.
InstructionsModal.refund-1: You (the owner) can refund payments by clicking on a transaction in Payments, then clicking "Refund Now".
InstructionsModal.refund-2: Employees cannot make refunds, as they are restricted from transferring funds due to security reasons.
InstructionsModal.refund-3: Instead, employees can label a payment as "To Refund" (click a transaction and check "To Refund"). At a later time, you will need to log into the Nulla App to make the appropriate refunds. To help with this process, we recommend you first search payments with the "To Refund" label to only view payments with this label.
InstructionsModal.refund-4: Security is our top concern and we believe this is the most secure way to conduct refunds.
InstructionsModal.cashout-1: Sign up for a {cex} account if you don't have one. <span1>You can register an account on the {cex} app or the {cex} website.</span1><span2>Pick an exchange that allows you to convert USDC to your local currency and allows USDC deposits on the Polygon chain.</span2>
InstructionsModal.cashout-2: Log into your {cex} account and find the USDC deposit address on Polygon. Paste this address into the "Cash Out Platform Address" field in the Settings menu of your Nulla App.
InstructionsModal.cashout-3: In the Nulla App, go to the Cash Out menu and transfer USDC to your {cex}.
InstructionsModal.cashout-4: Log into your {cex} and convert USDC to {merchantCurrency}. Then, withdraw the money to your bank.
InstructionsModal.cashout-tradeMAX: How To Convert USDC to TWD on MAX Exchange?
InstructionsModal.cashout-1cb: Sign up for a Coinbase account if you don't have one. Under "Settings" of your Coinbase account, link a bank account.
InstructionsModal.cashout-2cb: In the Cash Out menu of your Nulla App, click "Link your Coinbase account".
InstructionsModal.cashout-3cb: In the Cash Out menu, click "Transfer to Coinbase" to transfer USDC from your Nulla App to your Coinbase account. Wait 1-5 minutes for the Coinbase balance to update.
InstructionsModal.cashout-4cb: In the Cash Out menu, click "Transfer to Bank". When you submit a transfer, USDC will be automatically converted to {merchantCurrency} and the money will be deposited to your bank within 1-2 days.
InstructionsModal.cashback-1: We are temporarily requiring businesses give customers a 2% discount, which will be applied at the time of payment. The entire discount will go to the customer, as Nulla Pay does not make any profit from transactions.
InstructionsModal.cashback-2: Because most credit cards offer 1% cashback, the 2% discount is needed to help motivate customers to pay with USDC instead. Because Nulla Pay charges 0% fees and credit cards charge > 3% fees, you still save money when using Nulla Pay. Furthermore, the discount may attract new customers to your business.
InstructionsModal.cashback-3: When crypto payments become more popular, we will make this cashback optional.
InstructionsModal.fees-1: During payment, the customer pays a ~0.01 USDC blockchain fee. You (the business) pay zero fees. Nulla Pay does not charge any processing fees.
InstructionsModal.fees-2: When you transfer USDC from Nulla Pay to {cex}, there is a ~0.05 USDC blockchain fee.
InstructionsModal.fees-3cb: When you transfer funds from Coinbase to your bank, there is no transfer fee. However, as USDC will be converted to {merchantCurrency}, there is a 0.001-0.0015% conversion fee.
InstructionsModal.fees-3max: When you convert USDC to TWD on MAX Exchange, there is a 0.3% conversion fee.
InstructionsModal.fees-3none: When you convert USDC to your local currency on your cryptocurrency exchange, there may be a small conversion fee (typically 0.1-0.3%). Furthermore, when you transfer money to your bank, there may or may not be a fee. Please check the information on your cryptocurrency exchange.
InstructionsModal.fees-nonUSD-1: However, we remind you that when a customer pays, they are paying an extra 0.3% in USDC. These extra earnings should help reduce potential losses from fluctuating conversion rates or potential fees. Using Nulla Pay over other payment platforms (which typically have 1-5% in fees) should save you a significant amount of money.
InstructionsModal.fees-nonUSD-2: Finally, Nulla Pay does not profit from exchange rates, so you and your customers will always get the best USDC⇄{merchantCurrency} rates.
InstructionsModal.lose-1: Over the long run, you will not lose money from fluctuating USDC-to-{merchantCurrency} rates (in fact, you might earn a little).
InstructionsModal.lose-2: During payment, our interface alters the USDC-to-{merchantCurrency} market rate by 0.3% in favor of the business. This means that businesses will earn an extra 0.3%. Over the long run, these extra earnings should cover any potential losses from fluctuating rates.
InstructionsModal.lose-4: Let's assume the USDC-to-{merchantCurrency} rate is {rate}. When a customer enters {localSent} {merchantCurrency} in MetaMask and clicks "Pay", you will receive
InstructionsModal.lose-5: in your Nulla App. This includes the 2% discount that you had given to the customer. When you cash out to the bank and if the rate of {rate} did not change, you will receive {usdcReceived} * {rate} = {localReceived} {merchantCurrency}. With the 2% discount, you should have received {localReceivedIntended} {merchantCurrency}. Instead, you recieved {localReceived} {merchantCurrency} or an extra ~0.3%. These extra earnings should offset any losses from fluctuating exchange rates, if you cash out frequently (about once every 2 weeks).
InstructionsModal.lose-6: We don't believe customers will care about this extra 0.3%, as they are receiving a 2% discount from you already. But, even without this 2% discount, customers (particularly international travelers) will not care because the USDC-to-{merchantCurrency} rate used during payment will usually be 0.5-5% better than the USD-to-{merchantCurrency} rate they will get at any bank or currency exchanger.
InstructionsModal.rate-1: Nulla Pay uses the USDC⇄{merchantCurrency} rate from {cex}. This rate is usually 0.5-5% better than USD-to-{merchantCurrency} rate given by any bank or money exchanger.
InstructionsModal.rate-1USD: USDC is converted to USD at a 1:1 rate with no fees.

Common.reduceFxLossTooltip: When a customer pays, our interface alters the USDC-{merchantCurrency} rate by 0.3% in favor of the business. So, you actually earn an extra 0.3%. Customers will not mind the extra 0.3% because the USDC-to-{merchantCurrency} rate offered by Nulla Pay is usually 1-5% better than the USD-to-{merchantCurrency} rate at any bank.
